alert.note: Alert for Duplin; Lenoir; Onslow (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 6:51PM EDT until March 31 at 7:15PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT FOR CENTRAL JONES...SOUTH CENTRAL LENOIR...NORTHWESTERN ONSLOW AND EAST CENTRAL DUPLIN COUNTIES... At 651 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Comfort, or 9 miles north of Half Moon, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Jacksonville, Half Moon, Phillips Crossroads, Richlands, Maysville, Catherine Lake, Comfort, Potters Hill, Petersburg, Pleasant Hill, Richlands South, Loco VFD, Hargetts Crossroads and Trenton. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for eastern North Carolina. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please send your reports of hail and/or wind damage, including trees or large limbs downed, by calling the National Weather Service office in Newport at 1-800-889-6889.
